title: Use the parseInt Function with a Radix
content: The parseInt() function parses a string and returns an integer. It takes a second argument for the radix, which specifies the base of the number in the string. The radix can be an integer between 2 and 36.
The radix variable says that 11 is in the binary system, or base 2. This example convers the string 11 to an integer 3.

exercises.instruction: Use parseInt() in the convertToInteger function so it converts a binary number to an integer and returs it.

hint: convertToInteger should use the parseInt() function
